original: lus 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba ste rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba ste rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: This body is an incorrect perception, like a dream.

original: lus 'di ni sngon gyi las kyis gzugs brnyan snang ba ste gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni sngon gyi las kyis gzugs brnyan snang ba ste gzugs brnyan lta bu'o //
translated: This body is a reflection of past actions, like a reflection.

original: lus 'di ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir brag ca lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir brag ca lta bu'o //
translated: This body is like an echo, because it depends on conditions.

original: lus 'di ni sems 'khrugs shing 'gyes pa'i mtshan ma ste sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni sems 'khrugs shing 'gyes pa'i mtshan ma ste sprin lta bu'o //
translated: This body is a sign of the disturbance and dissolution of the mind, like a cloud.

original: lus 'di ni skad cig tu 'jig pa dang ldan zhing mi gnas pa ste glog dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni skad cig tu 'jig pa dang ldan zhing mi gnas pa ste glog dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: This body is momentary destruction and non-abiding, like a flash of lightning.

original: lus 'di ni rkyan sna tshogs las byung ba ste bdag po med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rkyan sna tshogs las byung ba ste bdag po med pa'o //
translated: This body is without a master, because it arises from various conditions.

original: lus 'di ni sa dang 'dra ste byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni sa dang 'dra ste byed pa med pa'o //
translated: This body is like the earth, for it has no self.

original: lus 'di ni chu dang 'dra ste bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni chu dang 'dra ste bdag med pa'o //
translated: This body is like water, for it has no self.

original: lus 'di ni me dang 'dra ste srog med pa'o //🔽lus 'di ni rlung dang 'dra ste gang zag med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni me dang 'dra ste srog med pa'o // lus 'di ni rlung dang 'dra ste gang zag med pa'o //
translated: This body is like fire, for it has no life.🔽This body is like wind, for it has no person.

original: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: This body is like space, for it has no intrinsic nature.

original: lus 'di ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas te yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //🔽lus 'di ni bdag dang bdag gi med pa ste stong pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas te yang dag pa ma yin pa'o // lus 'di ni bdag dang bdag gi med pa ste stong pa'o //
translated: This body is the abode of the great elements, but it is not real.

original: lus 'di ni /
analyzed: lus 'di ni /
translated: This body is empty, for it has no self or anything pertaining to a self.

original: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste bems po'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing dang / rtsig pa dang / bong ba dang / mig yor lta bu ste bems po'o //
translated: This body is like grass, trees, walls, clods of dirt, and illusions, for it is insensate.

original: lus 'di ni 'khrul 'khor dang ldan pa 'byung ste tshor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'khrul 'khor dang ldan pa 'byung ste tshor ba med pa'o //
translated: This body is a machine, for it has no feeling.

original: lus 'di ni rnag dang mi gtsang ba bsags pa ste gsog pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rnag dang mi gtsang ba bsags pa ste gsog pa'o //
translated: This body is a heap of filth, for it is a collection of pus and excrement.

original: lus 'di ni rtag tu byug pa dang / mnye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / 'gyes pa'i chos can te gsob bo //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rtag tu byug pa dang / mnye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / 'gyes pa'i chos can te gsob bo //
translated: This body is a fraud, for it is always in need of anointment, massage, and protection from injury.

original: lus 'di ni nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhis gtses pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhis gtses pa'o //
translated: This body is afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases.

original: lus 'di ni rtag tu rga bas zil gyis non pa ste khron pa rnying po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus 'di ni rtag tu rga bas zil gyis non pa ste khron pa rnying po dang 'dra'o //
translated: This body is always overcome by old age, like an old well.

original: lus 'di ni 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: This body is destined for death.

original: mthar mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mthar mi gnas pa'o //
translated: It does not last.

original: lus @163b 'di ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyis yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: lus @163b 'di ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyis yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: This body is made up of aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

original: gshed ma dang dug drag po dang / grong stong lta bu'o //
analyzed: gshed ma dang dug drag po dang / grong stong lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a murderer, a virulent poison, or an empty town.

original: khyed kyis de lta bu'i lus de la sun pa dang / skyo ba bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis de lta bu'i lus de la sun pa dang / skyo ba bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You should feel revulsion and disgust for such a body, and you should develop an interest in the body of the Tathāgata.

original: grogs po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste bsod nams las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: grogs po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste bsod nams las skyes pa'o //
translated: Friends, the body of the Tathāgata is the body of Dharma, born of merit.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sbyin pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni sbyin pa las skyes pa /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is born of generosity,

original: tshul khrims las skyes pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims las skyes pa /
translated: born of morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa /
translated: born of concentration,

original: shes rab las skyes pa /
analyzed: shes rab las skyes pa /
translated: born of wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba las skyes pa /
translated: born of liberation,🔽born of the knowledge and insight of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the wisdom that sees liberation.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms las skyes pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang / yang dag par sdom pa las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from generosity, discipline, and restraint.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las skyes pa /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the path of the ten virtuous actions.

original: bzod pa dang / des pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / des pa las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from patience and gentleness.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the roots of virtue that are stable through diligence.

original: bsam gtan dang ; rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ; rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from concentration, liberation, samādhi, and samāpatti.

original: thos pa dang / shes rab dang / thabs las skyes pa /
analyzed: thos pa dang / shes rab dang / thabs las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from learning, wisdom, and skillful means.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun las skyes pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong las skyes pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun las skyes pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and from śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: stobs bcu las skyes pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the ten powers.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi las skyes pa /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the four fearlessnesses.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las skyes pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad las skyes pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from all the perfections.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the superknowledges and the higher knowledges.

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba las skyes pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the abandonment of all that is unwholesome.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa las skyes pa ;🔽bden pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa las skyes pa ; bden pa las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from the gathering of all that is wholesome.🔽It arises from the truth.

original: yang dag pa nyid las skyes pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid las skyes pa /
translated: It arises from reality.

original: bag yod pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: It arises from heedfulness.

original: grogs po dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni dge ba'i las tshad med pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: grogs po dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni dge ba'i las tshad med pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: Friends, the body of the Tathāgata arises from immeasurable wholesome actions.

original: khyod kyis de ltar sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar sku la mos pa bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: You should generate such an aspiration toward the body.

original: dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed nas yang sus kyang log par sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi gnas rnyed nas yang sus kyang log par sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: Having attained the state of sovereignty, no one can cause you to turn back.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: You should practice correctly.

original: de la yang dag par sgrub pa ni bden pa'i le'u las 'byung ba /
analyzed: de la yang dag par sgrub pa ni bden pa'i le'u las 'byung ba /
translated: Correct practice is taught in the Chapter on the Truths:

original: skye dgu bskyangs pa la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyal pos 'du shes la gnas pa brgyad kyis mang du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: skye dgu bskyangs pa la brtson pa'i chos kyi rgyal pos 'du shes la gnas pa brgyad kyis mang du gnas par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma King, who is dedicated to protecting living beings, should frequently abide in eight recognitions.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /🔽skye dgu'i rigs @164a * //
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na / skye dgu'i rigs @164a * //
translated: What are the eight?🔽The recognition of all beings who belong to the family of living beings as his children;

original: su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la bu'i 'du shes dang / mi srun pa rnams la nad pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i 'du shes dang / bde ba rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / mi mdza' ba rnams la de'i gzhi la nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la bu'i 'du shes dang / mi srun pa rnams la nad pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i 'du shes dang / bde ba rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / mi mdza' ba rnams la de'i gzhi la nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the recognition of the unruly as sick; the recognition of the suffering as objects of compassion; the recognition of the happy as objects of joy; the recognition of those who are not friendly as having faults in their basis;

original: mdza' ba rnams la rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes dang / longs spyod rnams la sman gyi 'du shes dang / bdag la bdag med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mdza' ba rnams la rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes dang / longs spyod rnams la sman gyi 'du shes dang / bdag la bdag med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the recognition of the friendly as objects of protection; the recognition of wealth as medicine; and the recognition of selflessness in the self.

original: rgyal po chen po de la skye dgu'i rigs su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la bu'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni rgyal po de phas bu bcos pa ltar mi srun par tshar gcod pa la 'dug kyang snying rje'i bsam pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la skye dgu'i rigs su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la bu'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni rgyal po de phas bu bcos pa ltar mi srun par tshar gcod pa la 'dug kyang snying rje'i bsam pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Great King, the king who remains with the perception of a son toward all sentient beings who are included in the class of living beings is the king who, like a father correcting a son, does not give up the thought of compassion even when punishing the wicked.

original: mi srun pa rnams la nad pa'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni sman pa ltar gnod pa byed pa la mi khro zhing /
analyzed: mi srun pa rnams la nad pa'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni sman pa ltar gnod pa byed pa la mi khro zhing /
translated: The king who remains with the perception of a patient toward the wicked is the king who, like a physician, does not get angry at those who do harm,

original: skyon rab tu bsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skyon rab tu bsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba'o //
translated: but applies himself to completely removing their faults.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gnod pa thams cad yongs su spong zhing phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gnod pa thams cad yongs su spong zhing phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
translated: The king who remains with the perception of compassion toward the suffering is the king who engages in completely removing all their harms and accomplishing their welfare.

original: bde ba rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad la brnab sems dang / phrag dog gi sems mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba rnams la dga' ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad la brnab sems dang / phrag dog gi sems mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: The king who remains with the perception of joy toward the happy is the king who does not arouse thoughts of covetousness and jealousy toward the wealth and possessions of others.

original: mi mdza' ba rnams la de'i gzhi las nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gzhi yongs su spong ba ste ;
analyzed: mi mdza' ba rnams la de'i gzhi las nyes par lta ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni gzhi yongs su spong ba ste ;
translated: He abides with the perception of the danger of the basis in regard to enemies, by way of the view of the danger in their basis.

original: des skye bo gzhan lta ci smos kyi dgra rnams dang yang mdza' bar byed do //
analyzed: des skye bo gzhan lta ci smos kyi dgra rnams dang yang mdza' bar byed do //
translated: By this means, he becomes friendly even with enemies, much less with other people.

original: mdza' ba rnams la rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni mdza' ba brtan pa dang thams cad dang mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba rnams la rjes su srung ba'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni mdza' ba brtan pa dang thams cad dang mdza' ba'o //
translated: He abides with the perception of protection in regard to friends, by way of firm friendship and universal friendship.

original: longs spyod rnams la sman kyi 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la yongs su mi spyod cing longs spyod rnams la ma chags par yong su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rnams la sman kyi 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa la yongs su mi spyod cing longs spyod rnams la ma chags par yong su spyod pa'o //
translated: He abides with the perception of medicine in regard to pleasures, by way of not indulging in sexual misconduct and by way of not being attached to pleasures.

original: bdag la bdag med pa'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni chos don du gnyer zhing dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi drung du song ste rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la bdag med pa'i 'du shes kyis gnas pa ni chos don du gnyer zhing dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyi drung du song ste rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: He abides with the perception of selflessness in regard to self, by way of pursuing the Dharma, going into the presence of ascetics and brahmins, and engaging in the practice of the corresponding Dharma.

original: rgyal po chen po 'du shes la gnas pa brgyad po de dag gis gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po ni skyes phul ba tsam gyis kyang longs spyod rnams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi chos dang mi ldan pa ni g-yo'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'du shes la gnas pa brgyad po de dag gis gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po ni skyes phul ba tsam gyis kyang longs spyod rnams shin tu mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyi chos dang mi ldan pa ni g-yo'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: O Great King, the king who has these eight perceptions and is endowed with the Dharma, even if he just gives birth to them, his enjoyments will increase greatly.

original: bdun pa rnam pa thams cad kyis bsgrubs kyang de ltar 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdun pa rnam pa thams cad kyis bsgrubs kyang de ltar 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: But one who is not endowed with the Dharma will not increase in that way, even if he strives with deceit.

original: yid gnyis legs par @164b 'joms pa'i mdo las kyang chos bzhi dang ldan na rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba log par mi ltung ba'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid gnyis legs par @164b 'joms pa'i mdo las kyang chos bzhi dang ldan na rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba log par mi ltung ba'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: The Sutra on Thoroughly Defeating Doubts also says that a king who has four qualities will not fall into bad rebirths:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas myur du mnyes par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas myur du mnyes par byed cing /
translated: He quickly pleases the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Complete Buddha.

original: longs spyod chen po phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: He also fully takes up the perfection of great enjoyments.

original: bzhi gang zhen 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa srung ba'i phyir gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhen 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa srung ba'i phyir gnas pa yin /
translated: What are the four? They are: (1) to remain in order to protect the teachings of the Tathāgata;

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la smod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la smod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: (2) to criticize evil, nonvirtuous dharmas; (3) to uphold the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness; and (4) to generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: mi dge ba yongs su spang bar bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba yongs su spang bar bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is to be abandoned?”

original: nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs dag chos kyis gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la byin pa'i khyim gyi gzhi dang / zhing gi gzhi dang /
analyzed: nyi ma'i snying po'i le'u las 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs dag chos kyis gnas pa'i dge slong rnams la byin pa'i khyim gyi gzhi dang / zhing gi gzhi dang /
translated: The chapter on the essence of the sun states: “In the future, the kṣatriyas, brahmins, vaiśyas, and śūdras will take away the land and fields that have been given to the monks who abide by the Dharma.

original: kun dga' ra ba'i gzhi dang / skyed mos tshal dang / bran mo dang / bran pho dang / las byed pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad nas rkang 'gros kyi bar du byin pa la rku ba dang /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i gzhi dang / skyed mos tshal dang / bran mo dang / bran pho dang / las byed pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad nas rkang 'gros kyi bar du byin pa la rku ba dang /
translated: They will steal the land of the monasteries, the parks, the female and male servants, the workers, the bedding, the seats, the medicines for sicknesses, and the provisions, up to the vehicles.

original: rim gyis 'phrog pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'phrog pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will gradually take them away.

original: rgyal rigs nas mdangs rigs kyi bar du de dag tshe 'di la mi 'dod pa'i chos nyi shu dang myur du ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs nas mdangs rigs kyi bar du de dag tshe 'di la mi 'dod pa'i chos nyi shu dang myur du ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The kṣatriyas up to the śūdras will quickly come to possess twenty undesirable qualities in this life.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: lha 'phang bar 'gyur ba dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su de'i mi snyan pa grags par 'gyur ba dang / de'i mdza' ba dang / nye du dang / snag gi mnyen mtshams kyis bor bar 'gyur ba dang / de la dgra mang bar 'gyur ba dang /

translated: The ascetic practice related to effort is one:

original: cog pu ba nyid do //
analyzed: cog pu ba nyid do //
translated: to sit cross-legged.

original: de la phyag dar khrod pa'i yan lag gi ngo bo nyid ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la phyag dar khrod pa'i yan lag gi ngo bo nyid ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the ascetic practice of wearing robes made of rags from a dust heap is the practice of wearing robes made of rags from a dust heap.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi tshig gi don yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi tshig gi don yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the words of the other ascetic practices should be explained in the same way.

original: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni khyim bdag gi gos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni khyim bdag gi gos spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic practice of wearing robes made of rags from a dust heap is the rejection of the householder’s robes.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid ni gos bzhi pa spong ba yin no //🔽bsod snyoms pa nyid ni mgron du 'gro ba spong ba yin no//
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid ni gos bzhi pa spong ba yin no // bsod snyoms pa nyid ni mgron du 'gro ba spong ba yin no//
translated: The ascetic who wears only the three robes abandons the fourth garment.🔽The ascetic who lives on alms abandons invitations.

original: @166b mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid ni rnyogs par rgyu ba spong ba yin no //
analyzed: @166b mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid ni rnyogs par rgyu ba spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who goes in succession abandons the practice of going to a place where he is invited.

original: stan gcig pa nyid ni lan gnyis su 'dug pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: stan gcig pa nyid ni lan gnyis su 'dug pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who sits in one place abandons the practice of sitting in two places.

original: zas chog pa nyid ni zas mang po spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zas chog pa nyid ni zas mang po spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who is satisfied with little food abandons the practice of eating a lot.

original: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ni zas lhag pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ni zas lhag pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who does not eat after the proper time abandons the practice of eating at the wrong time.

original: dgon pa pa nyid ni grong mtha' bar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa pa nyid ni grong mtha' bar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who lives in the forest abandons the practice of living near the edge of a village.

original: shing drung pa nyid ni g-yogs par gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: shing drung pa nyid ni g-yogs par gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who lives at the foot of a tree abandons the practice of living under a roof.

original: bla gab med pa nyid ni g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: bla gab med pa nyid ni g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who lives in the open air abandons the practice of living under a roof or at the foot of a tree.

original: dur khrod pa nyid ni gzhan du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: dur khrod pa nyid ni gzhan du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who lives in a charnel ground abandons the practice of living elsewhere.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ni brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ni brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who lives wherever he happens to be abandons the practice of living in a place of comfort.

original: cog pu pa nyid ni nyal ba spong ba yin no //
analyzed: cog pu pa nyid ni nyal ba spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic who is a “rag-robe wearer” rejects bedding.

original: de la phyag dang khrod pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyag dang khrod pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len zhe na /
translated: How does one undertake the practice of being a “rag-robe wearer” and a “seafarer”?

original: khyim bdag gi gos tshol ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan la gsol ba byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi gos tshol ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan la gsol ba byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: One sees the disadvantages of seeking out, possessing, and begging for householders’ robes,

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan kyang mthong nas gos nar ma la gnas pa 'di skad du /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan kyang mthong nas gos nar ma la gnas pa 'di skad du /
translated: and one sees the advantages of being a “rag-robe wearer.”🔽One who is a “householder’s robe wearer” thinks,

original: de slan chad khyim bdag gi gos spangs te /
analyzed: de slan chad khyim bdag gi gos spangs te /
translated: “From now on, I reject householders’ robes

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: and undertake the practice of being a ‘rag-robe wearer.’”

original: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te gnas dam bcas pa nyid dang / mthun pa nyid dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid dang / ma rung ba mi byed pa nyid dang / yongs su spyod pa na lhag par ma chags pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te gnas dam bcas pa nyid dang / mthun pa nyid dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid dang / ma rung ba mi byed pa nyid dang / yongs su spyod pa na lhag par ma chags pa nyid dang /
translated: The advantages of being a “rag-robe wearer” are these: one is not bound to a particular place; one is not bound to companions; one is not dependent on others; one does not misuse one’s robes; one is not attached to fine robes when using robes;

original: brkam chags med pa nyid dang / chom rkun gyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / dus ma lags pa nyid dang / 'bags pa chung ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / dang bar byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang /
analyzed: brkam chags med pa nyid dang / chom rkun gyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / dus ma lags pa nyid dang / 'bags pa chung ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / dang bar byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid dang /
translated: It is not being greedy, not being robbed by thieves, not being at the wrong time, not being defiled, having few possessions, having the practice of a holy person, having the quality of inspiring confidence,

original: skyes bu phyi mas mthong nas rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i sgrub pa snang ba nyid dang / rgyal bas bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi mas mthong nas rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i sgrub pa snang ba nyid dang / rgyal bas bsngags pa ste /
translated: being followed by later generations, being the appearance of right practice, and being praised by the Victorious Ones.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These and other such qualities are those of the refuse-rag wearer.

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni rnam pa du zhig / phyag dar khrod pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni rnam pa du zhig / phyag dar khrod pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: How many kinds of refuse-rag wearers are there? What is a refuse-rag wearer?

original: gang gis ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: By what means is the refuse-rag wearer’s practice destroyed?

original: phyag dar khrod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of refuse-rag wearers:

original: bdag po med pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyis smad par grags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyis smad par grags pa'o //
translated: those who wear rags from a charnel ground and those who wear rags from a street.

original: de la dur khrod dam /
analyzed: de la dur khrod dam /
translated: The refuse rag-wearer uses rags taken from a charnel ground,

original: phyag dar gyi phung po'am /
analyzed: phyag dar gyi phung po'am /
translated: from a rubbish heap,

original: tshang 'dus sam /
analyzed: tshang 'dus sam /
translated: from a shop,

original: lam po che nas dam dum dag btus nas snam sbyar byas te 'chang @167a * //
analyzed: lam po che nas dam dum dag btus nas snam sbyar byas te 'chang @167a * //
translated: or from a highway, and then sews them together to make his robes.

original: ba 'di ni bdag po med pa'i phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
analyzed: ba 'di ni bdag po med pa'i phyag dar khrod pa yin no //
translated: This is the natural refuse rag-robe.

original: kha tshar bcad pa dang / phun tshar bcad pa dang / ba lang gis zos pa dang / byi bas zos pa dang / mes tshig pa dang / ya stags dang / ro bag gi gos dang / mu stegs can gyi mtshan ma 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyis smad par grags pa'i phyag dar khrod pa yin no //🔽phyag dar khrod pa ni khyim bdag gi gos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: kha tshar bcad pa dang / phun tshar bcad pa dang / ba lang gis zos pa dang / byi bas zos pa dang / mes tshig pa dang / ya stags dang / ro bag gi gos dang / mu stegs can gyi mtshan ma 'di dag ni rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyis smad par grags pa'i phyag dar khrod pa yin no // phyag dar khrod pa ni khyim bdag gi gos spong ba yin no //
translated: The refuse rag-robe is also the one that is rejected by others, such as that worn by a leper, a person with a skin disease, or a lunatic, or that cut with a knife, or that has been gnawed by mice, or that has been burned, or that has been used for a funeral rite, or that has been used to wrap a corpse, or that has been used to cover a corpse.🔽The refuse rag-robe is the one that is rejected by non-Buddhists.🔽The refuse rag-robe is rejected by householders.

original: khyim bdag gi gos blangs pas ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi gos blangs pas ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: The refuse rag-robe is rejected by those who are attached to the enjoyment of fine robes.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len zhe na /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len zhe na /
translated: How does one correctly take up the practice of wearing only the three robes?

original: chos gos lhag pa tshol ba dang / sbed pa dang / rung bar bya ba dang / 'bags pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: chos gos lhag pa tshol ba dang / sbed pa dang / rung bar bya ba dang / 'bags pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: He sees the disadvantages of seeking, hiding, and making suitable a surplus robe, and of being defiled.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan kyang mthong nas /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan kyang mthong nas /
translated: He sees the virtues of the three robes.

original: 'di skad du deng slan chad gos bzhi pa spangs te chos gos gsum pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: 'di skad du deng slan chad gos bzhi pa spangs te chos gos gsum pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: He should take them up with this thought: “From now on, I will avoid the fourth robe and take up the three robes.”

original: de la chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The virtues of the three robes are these:

original: 'gor yang ba'i tshul can nyid dang / gsog 'jog yongs su spangs pa nyid dang / khur chung ba nyid dang / lus 'tsho ba tsam gyis chog shes pa nyid dang / bya bzhin du gang dga' bar 'gro ba nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'gor yang ba'i tshul can nyid dang / gsog 'jog yongs su spangs pa nyid dang / khur chung ba nyid dang / lus 'tsho ba tsam gyis chog shes pa nyid dang / bya bzhin du gang dga' bar 'gro ba nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa dang /
translated: one is not burdened down; one avoids hoarding; one has a light load; one is satisfied with just enough to cover one’s body; one goes wherever one wants, like a bird; one has the conduct of a holy person;

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: one has the conduct of austerity. These are the virtues of the three robes.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid ni ci zhig yin chos gos gsum pa nyid ni gang zhig gang gis ni chos gos gsum pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid ni ci zhig yin chos gos gsum pa nyid ni gang zhig gang gis ni chos gos gsum pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: What is the threefold robe? What is the nature of the threefold robe? What is the abandonment of the threefold robe?

original: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthong gos te /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthong gos te /
translated: The threefold robe is the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: 'di dag ni chos gos gsum bdag yin te /🔽chos gos gsum ni gos bzhi ba spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos gos gsum bdag yin te / chos gos gsum ni gos bzhi ba spong ba yin no //
translated: These are the three robes.🔽The threefold robe is the abandonment of the fourth robe.

original: gos bzhi pa 'chad bas ni chos gos gsum pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: gos bzhi pa 'chad bas ni chos gos gsum pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: The fourth robe is the abandonment of the threefold robe.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does one undertake the practice of living on alms?

original: mgron du song nas rang gi las nyams pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / mi mthun pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dug na nyam nga ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: mgron du song nas rang gi las nyams pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / mi mthun pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dug na nyam nga ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: One sees the disadvantages of going to the homes of others, the disadvantages of being dependent on others, the disadvantages of encountering what is unappealing, and the disadvantages of being anxious when staying in one place.🔽One also sees the benefits of living on alms.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad mgron du 'gro ba spangs te bsod snyoms pa nyid la yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad mgron du 'gro ba spangs te bsod snyoms pa nyid la yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: One undertakes the practice of living on alms by saying, “I undertake the practice of living on alms, abandoning going to the homes of others.”

original: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The qualities of the alms-begging practitioner are as follows:

original: gnam bcas @167b pa dang mthun pa nyid dang / rang dbang yod pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi gso ba nyid dang / le lo med pa nyid dang / nga rgyal bcom pa nyid dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pas zhugs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gnam bcas @167b pa dang mthun pa nyid dang / rang dbang yod pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi gso ba nyid dang / le lo med pa nyid dang / nga rgyal bcom pa nyid dang / sems can la phan 'dogs pas zhugs pa nyid dang /
translated: he is in accord with the teachings of the Buddha, independent, not dependent on others, not lazy, his pride is destroyed, he is engaged in benefiting sentient beings,

original: ro'i sred pa las log pa nyid dang / phyogs rnams su thogs pa med pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: ro'i sred pa las log pa nyid dang / phyogs rnams su thogs pa med pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: he is free from craving for tastes, he is unobstructed in all directions, he is a true spiritual practitioner, and he is a practitioner of austerity.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These are the qualities of the alms-begging practitioner.

original: mgron yan lag du ba yin /
analyzed: mgron yan lag du ba yin /
translated: The guest is the third limb.

original: bsod snyoms pa gang yin /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa gang yin /
translated: What is the alms-begging practitioner?

original: gang gis ni bsod snyoms 'di 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni bsod snyoms 'di 'jig ce na /
translated: By what is this alms-begging practice destroyed?

original: mgron ni yan lag gsum pa ste /
analyzed: mgron ni yan lag gsum pa ste /
translated: The guest is the third limb.

original: zas rnam pa lnga gang za yang rung ba zhig la de ring ngam sang ngam nam dga' ba la mgron du bos pas ni mgron yin no //🔽bsod snyoms pa ni mgron du 'gro ba spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zas rnam pa lnga gang za yang rung ba zhig la de ring ngam sang ngam nam dga' ba la mgron du bos pas ni mgron yin no // bsod snyoms pa ni mgron du 'gro ba spong ba yin no //
translated: He is a guest when he invites himself to eat any of the five kinds of food, saying, “Today or tomorrow or whenever it is convenient.”🔽The alms-food practitioner renounces going as a guest.

original: mgron khas len pas ni bsod snyoms pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: mgron khas len pas ni bsod snyoms pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: By accepting invitations, he destroys the alms-food practice.

original: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does he correctly take up the practice of going on continuous alms round?

original: nar mar ster ba la gang dang gang du mang po dang gya nom pa nar ma rnyed pa de dang de kho na zhes yang dag par len te /🔽'gro na zan nar ma dang 'dra bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad nar mar ster ba spangs te /
analyzed: nar mar ster ba la gang dang gang du mang po dang gya nom pa nar ma rnyed pa de dang de kho na zhes yang dag par len te / 'gro na zan nar ma dang 'dra bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad nar mar ster ba spangs te /
translated: He takes it up by saying, “I will go to the houses where I can get continuous and abundant alms-food, and I will not go to the others.”

original: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid yang dag par len to //
analyzed: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid yang dag par len to //
translated: Seeing the disadvantages of not being a practitioner of austerity, and seeing the good qualities of the practice of going on continuous alms round, he says, “From now on, I will give up getting alms-food from selective houses and I will correctly take up the practice of going on continuous alms round.”

original: de la mthar chags su rgyu ba'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la mthar chags su rgyu ba'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The qualities of the gradual approach are as follows:

original: sems snyoms pa nyid dang / sems can la snying brtse ba nyid dang / khyim la ser sna spong ba nyid dang / khyim du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs med pa dag 'bod pa la mngon par mi dga' ba nyid dang / zas bzang po mi 'dam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems snyoms pa nyid dang / sems can la snying brtse ba nyid dang / khyim la ser sna spong ba nyid dang / khyim du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs med pa dag 'bod pa la mngon par mi dga' ba nyid dang / zas bzang po mi 'dam pa nyid dang /
translated: Even-mindedness, compassion for sentient beings, abandoning greed for the household life, not being attracted to the household life, not seeking out good food,

original: mi'i 'dzin pa las yongs su grol ba dang / lhan cig spyod pa rnam par spong ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: mi'i 'dzin pa las yongs su grol ba dang / lhan cig spyod pa rnam par spong ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: being free from human concerns, avoiding companions, and being content with few possessions.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //🔽mthar chags su rgyu ba ni gang zhig yin ;🔽brnyogs par rgyu ba ni gang gis spong /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no // mthar chags su rgyu ba ni gang zhig yin ; brnyogs par rgyu ba ni gang gis spong /
translated: These are the qualities of the gradual approach.🔽What is the gradual approach?🔽What is the distracted approach?

original: gang gis ni mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: What is the approach of the gradual approach?

original: mthar gyis rgyu ba ni bsod snyoms spyod pa na khyim dang pos bzung ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis rgyu ba ni bsod snyoms spyod pa na khyim dang pos bzung ste /
translated: The gradual approach is when a monk, while practicing for alms, first enters a house.

original: khyim mthar chags su rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: khyim mthar chags su rgyu ba yin no //
translated: He moves from house to house in a regular order.

original: mthar chags rgyu ba ni brnyogs par rgyu ba spong ba yin no //🔽brnyogs par rgyu bas ni mthar @168a * //
analyzed: mthar chags rgyu ba ni brnyogs par rgyu ba spong ba yin no // brnyogs par rgyu bas ni mthar @168a * //
translated: He moves in a regular order in order to avoid moving in a disorderly manner.

original: chags su rgyu ba nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: chags su rgyu ba nyid 'jig go //
translated: By moving in a disorderly manner, he would destroy the very thing he is trying to preserve.

original: stan gcig pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: stan gcig pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does he undertake to eat one meal a day?

original: lan gnyis su 'dug ste za na yang nas yang du 'dug nas byin len bya ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i bza' bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: lan gnyis su 'dug ste za na yang nas yang du 'dug nas byin len bya ba dang / yongs su longs spyod pa'i bza' bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: He sees the disadvantage of eating again and again by sitting down to eat twice, and he sees the advantage of eating one meal a day.

original: stan gcig ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang blangs nas yang mi len pa'o //
analyzed: stan gcig ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang blangs nas yang mi len pa'o //
translated: Having taken it up, he does not give it up.

original: zas phyis mi len pa ni zas lhag par spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa ni zas lhag par spong ba yin no //
translated: He undertakes not to eat at improper times in order to avoid eating again.

original: zas lhag pa za bas ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: zas lhag pa za bas ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: By eating again, he would destroy the very thing he is trying to preserve.

original: dgon pa pa nyid de ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa nyid de ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does he undertake to live in the forest?

original: grong mthar gnas na mi 'dod pa'i yul gyis 'khrug pa dang / chags pa skye ba dang 'dzin par gnas pa nyid kyi nyes dmigs kyang mthong /🔽dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad grong mthar gnas pa spangs te /
analyzed: grong mthar gnas na mi 'dod pa'i yul gyis 'khrug pa dang / chags pa skye ba dang 'dzin par gnas pa nyid kyi nyes dmigs kyang mthong / dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad grong mthar gnas pa spangs te /
translated: If one lives in a village, one sees the disadvantages of being disturbed by unpleasant objects, of attachment arising, and of remaining in a state of grasping.

original: dgon par gnas pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: Having seen the virtues of living in a forest, one should take up the vow, saying, “From now on, I will abandon living in a village and take up living in a forest.”

original: de la dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The virtues of living in a forest are as follows:

original: mi 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spong ba nyid dang / gtam gyi gzhi bcu yang dag par ston pa dang / shin tu mdzes pa nyid dang / lhas bskul ba nyid dang 'du 'dzi la dga' ba don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / dben pa'i bde ba ci 'dod pa thob pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i yul yongs su spong ba nyid dang / gtam gyi gzhi bcu yang dag par ston pa dang / shin tu mdzes pa nyid dang / lhas bskul ba nyid dang 'du 'dzi la dga' ba don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / dben pa'i bde ba ci 'dod pa thob pa nyid dang /
translated: One abandons unpleasant objects, one teaches the ten topics of conversation, one is very beautiful, one is urged by the gods, one does not strive for pleasure in social interactions, one obtains the bliss of solitude as one wishes, one is not separated from the Dharma, and one is not separated from the gods.

original: sgra chung bas rnal 'byor dang mthun pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang ; yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: sgra chung bas rnal 'byor dang mthun pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang ; yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: It is suitable for spiritual practice because it is quiet, it is the conduct of holy beings, and it is the way of austerity.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These and other qualities are those of the forest dweller.

original: dgon pa'i gnas mal gyi mtha' ni gang yin /🔽dgon pa pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas mal gyi mtha' ni gang yin / dgon pa pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the limit of the forest dwelling place?🔽Who is the forest dweller?

original: gang gis ni dgon pa pa nyid 'jig ce na /🔽grong dang / grong gi nye 'khor dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / kun dga'i nye 'khor ma gtogs pa mi 'bring gi khru bzhi la gzhu ste /
analyzed: gang gis ni dgon pa pa nyid 'jig ce na / grong dang / grong gi nye 'khor dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / kun dga'i nye 'khor ma gtogs pa mi 'bring gi khru bzhi la gzhu ste /
translated: By what is the forest dweller destroyed?🔽The forest dwelling place is five hundred bow-lengths from a village, except for a park, a garden, or a place nearby.

original: gzhu de lta bu'i gzhu lnga brgya 'di ni dgon pa'i gnas mal gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gzhu de lta bu'i gzhu lnga brgya 'di ni dgon pa'i gnas mal gyi mtha' yin no //
translated: This is the limit of the forest dwelling place.

original: dgon pa pa ni grong mthar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa pa ni grong mthar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The forest dweller is one who abandons dwelling near a village.

original: shing drung pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: shing drung pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does one correctly take up dwelling at the foot of a tree?

original: g-yogs par gnas pa yongs su gzung ba dang / bcos legs bya ba dang / gzhan la gsol ba dang / longs spyod kyi nyes dmigs dag kyang mthong /🔽shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: g-yogs par gnas pa yongs su gzung ba dang / bcos legs bya ba dang / gzhan la gsol ba dang / longs spyod kyi nyes dmigs dag kyang mthong / shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du /
translated: He should keep his dwelling covered, well-repaired, and he should ask others for help. He should see the disadvantages of possessions and🔽the advantages of living at the foot of a tree.🔽

original: deng slan chad g-yogs par gnas pa spangs te shing drung pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: deng slan chad g-yogs par gnas pa spangs te shing drung pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: “I will avoid staying in covered places and instead take up staying at the foot of a tree. I will avoid staying in covered places and instead take up staying at the foot of a tree.”🔽“What are the qualities of staying at the foot of a tree?

original: de la shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: They are as follows:

original: @168b gnas dam bcas pa dang / mthun pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid dang / las la dga' ba yongs su spong ba nyid dang / lhas bskul ba nyid dang / gnas la ser sna spong ba nyid dang / chags pa rab tu spong ba nyid dang /
analyzed: @168b gnas dam bcas pa dang / mthun pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid dang / las la dga' ba yongs su spong ba nyid dang / lhas bskul ba nyid dang / gnas la ser sna spong ba nyid dang / chags pa rab tu spong ba nyid dang /
translated: One’s conduct is in accord with the precepts, one’s possessions are few, one avoids being fond of work, one is urged on by the gods, one avoids being stingy about one’s dwelling place, one avoids attachment,

original: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ste /
translated: one’s conduct is that of a holy being, and one’s possessions are few.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni shing drung pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These are the qualities of the tree-root-dweller.

original: shing drung gi tshad ci tsam zhig yin /
analyzed: shing drung gi tshad ci tsam zhig yin /
translated: What is the measure of a tree root?

original: shing ji lta bu ni spong bar bya /
analyzed: shing ji lta bu ni spong bar bya /
translated: What kind of tree should be avoided?

original: shing drung pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: shing drung pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the tree-root-dweller?

original: gang gis ni shing drung pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni shing drung pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: By what is the tree-root-dweller’s practice destroyed?

original: nyi ma gung gi dus su grib mas ji srid khyab pa dang / rlung med par lo ma dag ji srid du lhags pa de srid ni shing drung gi tshad yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma gung gi dus su grib mas ji srid khyab pa dang / rlung med par lo ma dag ji srid du lhags pa de srid ni shing drung gi tshad yin no //
translated: The measure of a tree root is the extent to which the shade covers at midday and the extent to which leaves fall in the absence of wind.

original: shing drung pas sdong rgan dang / shing khong stong dang / shing nyen can spang bar bya'o //🔽shing drung pa ni g-yogs bar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: shing drung pas sdong rgan dang / shing khong stong dang / shing nyen can spang bar bya'o // shing drung pa ni g-yogs bar gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: The tree-root-dweller should avoid an old stump, a hollow tree, and a tree with a disease.🔽The tree-root-dweller abandons the practice of staying under a roof.

original: g-yogs bar gnas pas ni shing drung pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: g-yogs bar gnas pas ni shing drung pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: The roof-dweller destroys the practice of the tree-root-dweller.

original: bla gab med pa nyid ji ltar yang dag bar len ce na /
analyzed: bla gab med pa nyid ji ltar yang dag bar len ce na /
translated: How does one properly take up the practice of the open-air-dweller?

original: g-yogs pa dang / shing drung gi gnas tshol ba dang / yongs su bzung bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: g-yogs pa dang / shing drung gi gnas tshol ba dang / yongs su bzung bas yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba ste /
translated: He then undertakes: “From now on I will avoid seeking a roof-cover and a dwelling at the foot of a tree.

original: bla gab med pa nyid yang dag bar len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: bla gab med pa nyid yang dag bar len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: I will undertake to live without a roof-cover.”

original: de la bla gab med pa'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te ;
analyzed: de la bla gab med pa'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin te ;
translated: The virtues of living without a roof-cover are:

original: brtson pa mi gtong ba nyid dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid spangs pa dang / ri dags lta bu nyid dang / phyogs bzhi spyad pa dang / rten pa med pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: brtson pa mi gtong ba nyid dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid spangs pa dang / ri dags lta bu nyid dang / phyogs bzhi spyad pa dang / rten pa med pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: not abandoning striving, avoiding sluggishness and sleep, being like a deer, not being attached to any direction, being a person of good conduct, and having few desires with regard to requisites.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni bla gab med pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni bla gab med pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These are the virtues of living without a roof-cover.

original: bla gab med pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: bla gab med pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is living without a roof-cover?

original: gang gis bla gab med pa nyid 'di 'jig ce na /🔽bla gab med pas ni g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bla gab med pa nyid 'di 'jig ce na / bla gab med pas ni g-yogs pa dang / shing drung du gnas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: What does one reject by living in the open air?🔽One rejects living under a roof and living at the foot of a tree.

original: g-yogs pa dang shing drung na gnas pas ni bla gab med pa nyid 'di 'jig go //
analyzed: g-yogs pa dang shing drung na gnas pas ni bla gab med pa nyid 'di 'jig go //
translated: By living under a roof or at the foot of a tree, one rejects living in the open air.

original: dur khrod pa nyid ji ltar yang dag bar len ce na /
analyzed: dur khrod pa nyid ji ltar yang dag bar len ce na /
translated: How does one undertake the practice of living in a charnel ground?

original: gzhan du gnas na sems yid mi 'byung ba nyid dang bag med pa mang ba nyid kyi nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: gzhan du gnas na sems yid mi 'byung ba nyid dang bag med pa mang ba nyid kyi nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: One sees the disadvantage of living elsewhere, where the mind is not at ease and one is not heedful.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du der slan chad lan gnyis su 'dug ste za ba spangs te stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di skad du der slan chad lan gnyis su 'dug ste za ba spangs te stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len to //
translated: Having seen this, one says: “From now on, I reject eating in two sittings and undertake the practice of eating in one sitting.”

original: de la stan gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la stan gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan 'di dag yin te /
translated: The advantages of eating in one sitting are as follows.

original: zos pa 'ju ba nyid dang / brkam @169a * //
analyzed: zos pa 'ju ba nyid dang / brkam @169a * //
translated: One’s food is digested properly and one is not greedy.

original: chags med pa nyid dang / zas lhag par mi za ba nyid dang / 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / zo mdog bde ba nyid dang / rang gi las mi nyams pa nyid dang / reg par gnas pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang /🔽yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: chags med pa nyid dang / zas lhag par mi za ba nyid dang / 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / zo mdog bde ba nyid dang / rang gi las mi nyams pa nyid dang / reg par gnas pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: He is not attached, does not eat leftovers, has few desires, is healthy, does not neglect his duties, is easy to live with, has the conduct of a holy person, and is austere.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni stan gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //🔽stan gcig pa ni du zhig stan gcig pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni stan gcig pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no // stan gcig pa ni du zhig stan gcig pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: These and other such qualities are those of the one who practices the single sitting.

original: zas kyi mtha' ni gang yin /
analyzed: zas kyi mtha' ni gang yin /
translated: How many are single sitters? Who is a single sitter? What is the end of meals?

original: gang gis ni stan gcig pa 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni stan gcig pa 'jig ce na /
translated: By what is the single sitting broken?

original: stan gcig pa gsum ste stan gyi mtha' pa dang / chu'i mtha' pa dang / zas kyi mtha' pa'o //
analyzed: stan gcig pa gsum ste stan gyi mtha' pa dang / chu'i mtha' pa dang / zas kyi mtha' pa'o //
translated: There are three single sitters: the one who ends at the end of the seat, the one who ends at the end of the water, and the one who ends at the end of the meal.

original: de la stan gyi mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos nas stan las langs te yang mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: de la stan gyi mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos nas stan las langs te yang mi za ba yin no //
translated: The one who ends at the end of the seat stands up from his seat after eating and does not eat again.

original: chu'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos nas stan la 'dug kyang ltung bzed du chu blangs nas yang mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: chu'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos nas stan la 'dug kyang ltung bzed du chu blangs nas yang mi za ba yin no //
translated: The one who has water as his limit does not drink water after he has eaten.

original: zas kyi mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni za ba na kham gyi tha ma med nas yang mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: zas kyi mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni za ba na kham gyi tha ma med nas yang mi za ba yin no //
translated: The one who has food as his limit does not eat again after he has eaten and has set aside a little food.

original: stan gcig pa ni lan gnyis su 'dug ste /🔽zab spong ba yin no //
analyzed: stan gcig pa ni lan gnyis su 'dug ste / zab spong ba yin no //
translated: The one who has one sitting does not eat again after he has eaten and has gotten up from his seat.🔽The one who has one eating does not eat again after he has eaten and has gotten up from his seat.

original: zas kyi mtha' ni chu dang sman ma gtogs pa med par bya ba gang cung zad ci yang rung ba yin no //
analyzed: zas kyi mtha' ni chu dang sman ma gtogs pa med par bya ba gang cung zad ci yang rung ba yin no //
translated: The one who has food as his limit does not eat again after he has eaten and has set aside a little food.🔽The one who has one sitting does not eat again after he has eaten and has gotten up from his seat.

original: lan gnyis su 'dug ste za bas stan gcig pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: lan gnyis su 'dug ste za bas stan gcig pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: The one who has one eating does not eat again after he has eaten and has gotten up from his seat.

original: zas chog pa pa ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: zas chog pa pa ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does one undertake the practice of being satisfied with what one gets?

original: zas mang du zos na lus lci bar byed pa dang / phul skye ba dang / 'dod chen che ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: zas mang du zos na lus lci bar byed pa dang / phul skye ba dang / 'dod chen che ba nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: One sees the disadvantage of eating a lot: the body becomes heavy, one becomes prone to laziness, one becomes very greedy, and one does not practice austerity.

original: zas chog pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad zas mang po spangs te zas chog pa pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par lan to //
analyzed: zas chog pa pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad zas mang po spangs te zas chog pa pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par lan to //
translated: Having seen the qualities of contentment with food, he should take up contentment with food, saying, “From now on I will abandon overeating and take up contentment with food.”

original: de la zas chog pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /🔽phul mi skye ba nyid dang / zas kyi tshod zin pa nyid dang / zas mang du za ba'i gnad shes pa nyid dang lus kyi gnas ngan len bsrabs pa dang / de la chags pa spong ba dang / gnod pa chung ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la zas chog pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te / phul mi skye ba nyid dang / zas kyi tshod zin pa nyid dang / zas mang du za ba'i gnad shes pa nyid dang lus kyi gnas ngan len bsrabs pa dang / de la chags pa spong ba dang / gnod pa chung ba shes pa dang /
translated: The qualities of contentment with food are these:

original: kun nas ldang ba yang dag par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba yang dag par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: not being reborn in the lower realms, knowing the right amount of food, knowing the disadvantages of overeating, reducing the unwholesome tendencies of the body, abandoning attachment to that, knowing the small amount of harm, abandoning the mental afflictions, the conduct of holy beings, and the practice of austerity.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni zas chog pa pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni zas chog pa pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These and others are the qualities of contentment with food.

original: zas kyi tshad ni ji ltar 'dzin /
analyzed: zas kyi tshad ni ji ltar 'dzin /
translated: How does one take up the right amount of food?

original: zas chog pa pa ni gang yin no //
analyzed: zas chog pa pa ni gang yin no //
translated: What is contentment with food?

original: gang gis ni zas chog pa pa 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni zas chog pa pa 'jig ce na /
translated: By what means does one become a person who has enough food?

original: 'bras bre'u chung gang gi 'bras chan lhung bzed du blangs nas chog pa'i mtshan ma la nye bar rtog cing /
analyzed: 'bras bre'u chung gang gi 'bras chan lhung bzed du blangs nas chog pa'i mtshan ma la nye bar rtog cing /
translated: One is a person who has enough food when one takes up food in the begging bowl, and then examines the signs of satisfaction.

original: de'i 'og tu mi blang ba'i mtshan @169b ma la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi blang ba'i mtshan @169b ma la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: After that, one is skilled in the signs of not taking more.

original: goms pa na lto'i tshad kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa na lto'i tshad kyang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is accustomed to this, one also knows the proper amount for the stomach.

original: zas chog ba pa ni zas mang po spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zas chog ba pa ni zas mang po spong ba yin no //
translated: A person who has enough food is one who avoids a lot of food.

original: zas tshad las lhag pas ni zas chog pa pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: zas tshad las lhag pas ni zas chog pa pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: A person who has enough food destroys that very quality by eating more than the proper amount.

original: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na zas lhag bar zos na phul skye ba dang / gzhan la rag las pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na zas lhag bar zos na phul skye ba dang / gzhan la rag las pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa ma yin pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: How does one correctly take up the quality of not taking food later? One sees the disadvantages of eating leftover food, of being dependent on others, and of not being a renunciate.

original: zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad zas lhag pa spangs te zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du deng slan chad zas lhag pa spangs te zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: From now on I undertake to abandon taking food in the evening.

original: de la zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The virtues of not taking food in the evening are these:

original: re ba rab tu chad pa dang / dgang sla ba dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid dang / gsog 'jog yongs su spong ba dang / yong mi tshol ba nyid dang / brkam chags med pa nyid dang / phul mi skye ba nyid dang /
analyzed: re ba rab tu chad pa dang / dgang sla ba dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa nyid dang / gsog 'jog yongs su spong ba dang / yong mi tshol ba nyid dang / brkam chags med pa nyid dang / phul mi skye ba nyid dang /
translated: cutting off hope, being easy to fill, not depending on others, abandoning hoarding, not seeking, being free from greed, not being reborn in the lower realms,

original: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs ba'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni zas phyis mi len pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs ba'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni zas phyis mi len pa'i yon tan dag yin no //
translated: being a practice of holy beings, having the way of few possessions, and so on. These are the virtues of not taking food in the evening.

original: zas phyis mi len pa ni du zhig / zas phyis mi len pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa ni du zhig / zas phyis mi len pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: How many kinds of not taking food in the evening are there? What is not taking food in the evening?

original: gang gis ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid 'di 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid 'di 'jig ce na /
translated: What is the reason for not taking food again?

original: zas phyis mi blang ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: zas phyis mi blang ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of not taking food again:

original: lhag pa'i mtha' ba nyid dang / bzung ba'i mtha' ba'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i mtha' ba nyid dang / bzung ba'i mtha' ba'o //
translated: the one who takes food until the end of the period, and the one who takes food until the end of the holding.

original: de la lhag pa'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos te spangs nas yang mi za ba'o //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni zos te spangs nas yang mi za ba'o //
translated: The one who takes food until the end of the period is the one who, having eaten, does not eat again, having rejected it.

original: bzung ba'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi skal ba gcig / dur khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: bzung ba'i mtha' pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi skal ba gcig / dur khrod pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad du /
translated: The one who takes food until the end of the holding is the one who, having seen the virtues of the charnel-ground dweller, says:

original: deng slan chad gzhan du gnas pa spangs te /
analyzed: deng slan chad gzhan du gnas pa spangs te /
translated: From now on, having rejected dwelling elsewhere,

original: dur khrod pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: dur khrod pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: I take up the practice of the charnel-ground dweller.

original: de la dur khrod ba'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: de la dur khrod ba'i yon tan ni 'di dag yin no //
translated: The virtues of the charnel-ground dweller are these.

original: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa 'thob ba dang / mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'thob pa dang / mis bla mar bkur ba dang / mi ma yin pas bla mar bkur ba dang / bag yod pa'i rgyu skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa spong ba nyid dang /
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa 'thob ba dang / mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'thob pa dang / mis bla mar bkur ba dang / mi ma yin pas bla mar bkur ba dang / bag yod pa'i rgyu skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa spong ba nyid dang /
translated: The attainment of mindfulness of death, the attainment of the sign of the unattractive, being respected by humans, being respected by non-humans, the cause of being born heedful, the abandonment of the desire realm,

original: yid 'byung ba mang ba nyid dang / 'jigs pa dang skrag pa bzod pa nyid dang / gson pas rgyags pa spong ba nyid dang / lus kyi rang bzhin la yang dang yang du so sor rtog pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba mang ba nyid dang / 'jigs pa dang skrag pa bzod pa nyid dang / gson pas rgyags pa spong ba nyid dang / lus kyi rang bzhin la yang dang yang du so sor rtog pa nyid dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang /
translated: the abundance of renunciation, the patience of fear and terror, the abandonment of intoxication with life, the repeated discernment of the nature of the body, the conduct of holy beings,

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: the practice of austerity.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dur khrod ba nyid kyi yon tan @170a * //🔽dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni dur khrod ba nyid kyi yon tan @170a * // dag yin no //
translated: Such are the qualities of being a charnel ground dweller.

original: dur khrod ji lta bur ni gnas par bya'o //🔽dur khrod pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: dur khrod ji lta bur ni gnas par bya'o // dur khrod pa ni gang yin /
translated: How should one dwell in the charnel ground?🔽Who is a charnel ground dweller?

original: gang gis ni dur khrod pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni dur khrod pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: By what is the state of being a charnel ground dweller destroyed?

original: dang por ni rtag tu sreg pa dang / du ba dang / 'bar ba dang / du ba yod pa de lta bu'i dur khrod du gnas par bya la /
analyzed: dang por ni rtag tu sreg pa dang / du ba dang / 'bar ba dang / du ba yod pa de lta bu'i dur khrod du gnas par bya la /
translated: First, one should live in a charnel ground that is always burning, smoky, and flaming, and that has corpses.

original: de nas ni dur khrod gzhan gang yang rung bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ni dur khrod gzhan gang yang rung bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should live in any other charnel ground.

original: dur khrod pas dur khrod du spyil bu dang / khang pa mi bya /
analyzed: dur khrod pas dur khrod du spyil bu dang / khang pa mi bya /
translated: One who lives in a charnel ground should not build a hut or house in a charnel ground.

original: rlung yas ldang ba mas ldang bar gnas par mi bya /
analyzed: rlung yas ldang ba mas ldang bar gnas par mi bya /
translated: One should not live in a place where the wind blows from a charnel ground.

original: khu 'phrig can du gnas par mi bya /
analyzed: khu 'phrig can du gnas par mi bya /
translated: One should not live in a place that is frightening.

original: nya sha dang / sha dang / 'o ma dang / til gyi chur phye dang / mon sran gre'u'i bza' ba bsten par mi bya /
analyzed: nya sha dang / sha dang / 'o ma dang / til gyi chur phye dang / mon sran gre'u'i bza' ba bsten par mi bya /
translated: One should not eat fish, meat, milk, sesame oil, or mung beans.

original: lhung bzed sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: lhung bzed sbyin par mi bya /
translated: One should not give away one's begging-bowl.

original: khyim du 'dug bar mi bya /
analyzed: khyim du 'dug bar mi bya /
translated: One should not live in a house.

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs lhags na khri'u dang chos gos dang / ril ba blangs te song na sreg pa nas ha cang yang mi ring ba rdo rgyang gis sleb tsam gyi nang du dur khrod du gnas bar bya zhing /
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs lhags na khri'u dang chos gos dang / ril ba blangs te song na sreg pa nas ha cang yang mi ring ba rdo rgyang gis sleb tsam gyi nang du dur khrod du gnas bar bya zhing /
translated: When a crowd of people comes, one should take one's seat, Dharma robes, and water-pitcher, and go to live in a charnel ground not too far from a village, within range of a stone thrown by a strong man.

original: skye rengs shar nas khri'u dang / chos gos dang / ril ba blangs nas slar 'gro bar bya ba 'di ni 'di'i spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: skye rengs shar nas khri'u dang / chos gos dang / ril ba blangs nas slar 'gro bar bya ba 'di ni 'di'i spyod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of the refuse-rag wearer is to go out after sunrise, to take the seat, the robe, and the bowl, and to return.

original: dur khrod pa ni gzhan du gnas spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dur khrod pa ni gzhan du gnas spangs pa yin no //
translated: The charnel-ground dweller rejects other dwellings.

original: gzhan du gnas pa khas len pas ni dur khrod pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: gzhan du gnas pa khas len pas ni dur khrod pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: By accepting other dwellings, the charnel-ground dweller’s practice is lost.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ji ltar yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does one take up the practice of the as-found?

original: brkam chags kyi gnas mal la phan tshun ldang ba pha rol la gnod pa byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: brkam chags kyi gnas mal la phan tshun ldang ba pha rol la gnod pa byed pa'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: One sees the disadvantages of a greedy search for bedding and seats, and of causing harm to others.

original: gzhi ji lta ba bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad ces deng slan chad brkam chags kyi gnas mal spangs te gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid yang dag bar len to zhes yang dag par len to //
analyzed: gzhi ji lta ba bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad ces deng slan chad brkam chags kyi gnas mal spangs te gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid yang dag bar len to zhes yang dag par len to //
translated: One sees the advantages of the as-found, and one takes it up with the thought, “From this day forward, I take up the as-found, rejecting a greedy search for bedding and seats.”

original: de la gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The advantages of the as-found are as follows.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog la bla mar bkur ba dang / de ltar rnyed pas chog shes pa dang / de la chags pa spong ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang / gcig pu nyid la dga' ba dang / dad par bya ba nyid dang /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog la bla mar bkur ba dang / de ltar rnyed pas chog shes pa dang / de la chags pa spong ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang / gcig pu nyid la dga' ba dang / dad par bya ba nyid dang /
translated: 5. He delights in solitude.🔽6. He is worthy of reverence.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te /
translated: 7. He has the conduct of a holy person.🔽8. He has the way of few desires.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa ni gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa ni gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: These and other such qualities are the qualities of the right basis.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the right basis?

original: gang gis ni gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: By what is the right basis destroyed?

original: gzhi ji bzhin ba ni brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin ba ni brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba yin te /
translated: The right basis is the abandonment of the bed and seat of greed.
