original: brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba zhes bya ba ni snga na 'dug pa bslang nas gnas mal len par mi byed do //
analyzed: brkam chags kyi gnas mal spong ba zhes bya ba ni snga na 'dug pa bslang nas gnas mal len par mi byed do //
translated: The abandonment of the bed and seat of greed means that one does not take a bed and seat after having roused up one who is already there.

original: brkam @170b chags kyi gnas mal len pas ni gzhi ji bzhi pa nyid 'jig go //
analyzed: brkam @170b chags kyi gnas mal len pas ni gzhi ji bzhi pa nyid 'jig go //
translated: The taking of the bed and seat of greed destroys the right basis.

original: ji ltar cog pu pa nyid yang dag par len ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar cog pu pa nyid yang dag par len ce na /
translated: How does he take up the cross-legged posture?

original: nyal na rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / le lo'i dbang du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
analyzed: nyal na rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / le lo'i dbang du 'gro ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong /
translated: He sees the disadvantage of going to sleep and falling under the influence of drowsiness, sleep, and laziness.

original: cog pu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad ces deng slan chad nyal ba spangs te cog pu pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag bar len to //
analyzed: cog pu ba nyid kyi yon tan dag kyang mthong nas 'di skad ces deng slan chad nyal ba spangs te cog pu pa nyid yang dag par len to zhes yang dag bar len to //
translated: Seeing the advantages of the cross-legged posture, he takes up the cross-legged posture, saying, “From now on, I will give up sleeping and take up the cross-legged posture.”

original: de la cog pu pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la cog pu pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The advantages of the cross-legged posture are as follows:

original: le lo'i gzhi yongs su spong ba dang / lus la chags pa dang / ser sna yongs su spong ba dang / 'phres pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa dang / brtsal ba nyung ba dang / gnyid chung ba dang / rnal 'byor dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: le lo'i gzhi yongs su spong ba dang / lus la chags pa dang / ser sna yongs su spong ba dang / 'phres pa'i bde ba la ma chags pa dang / brtsal ba nyung ba dang / gnyid chung ba dang / rnal 'byor dang mthun pa dang /
translated: It eliminates the basis of laziness, it eliminates attachment to the body and attachment to possessions, it is not attached to the pleasure of stretching, it requires little effort, it requires little sleep, it is conducive to yoga, it is conducive to meditation, it is conducive to the attainment of the goal, it is conducive to the attainment of the goal of the ascetic life, it is conducive to the attainment of the goal of the holy life, it is conducive to the attainment of nirvana, and it is conducive to the attainment of the goal of the ascetic life.

original: lus kyi gnas rgya skye ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni cog pu pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas rgya skye ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa nyid dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul can te de lta bu la sogs pa ni cog pu pa nyid kyi yon tan dag yin no //
translated: The qualities of the ascetic are: the place where he lives, the behavior of the holy man, the practice of austerity, etc.

original: cog pu pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: cog pu pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the ascetic?

original: gang gis ni cog pu pa nyid 'jig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis ni cog pu pa nyid 'jig ce na /
translated: What destroys the ascetic?

original: cog pu pa ni nyal ba spong ba yin no //
analyzed: cog pu pa ni nyal ba spong ba yin no //
translated: The ascetic is one who abandons lying down.

original: nyal ba khas len pas ni cog pu pa nyid 'jig go //🔽de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni phyag dar khrod pa nar mar spyod pa la gal te khyim bdag dag gis chos gos gso ras sam /🔽ras bal gyi ras sam mon dar ram /🔽la ba dag byin par gyur na skabs phye bas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyal ba khas len pas ni cog pu pa nyid 'jig go // de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni phyag dar khrod pa nar mar spyod pa la gal te khyim bdag dag gis chos gos gso ras sam / ras bal gyi ras sam mon dar ram / la ba dag byin par gyur na skabs phye bas blang bar bya ste /
translated: The ascetic is destroyed by accepting lying down.🔽The ascetic who accepts the practice of wearing robes made of rags should not accept robes made of cotton, silk, or wool, if they are offered by householders.

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he accepts them, he destroys the ascetic.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni kha bskang ba'i re ba yod na gos lhag zhag bcur 'chang ba dang / gnas mal srung ba'i phyir gding ba dang / steng du gding ba dang / nad kyi rkyen g-yan pa dgab pa dang /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni kha bskang ba'i re ba yod na gos lhag zhag bcur 'chang ba dang / gnas mal srung ba'i phyir gding ba dang / steng du gding ba dang / nad kyi rkyen g-yan pa dgab pa dang /
translated: The opportunity to possess the three robes is to possess an extra robe for ten days, to use a mat to protect the bedding, to use a mat on top of the bedding, to use a cloth to cover a rash,

original: gdong phyis kyi gos dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / gzhan gyi rung ba bcol ba skabs phye bas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdong phyis kyi gos dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / gzhan gyi rung ba bcol ba skabs phye bas blang bar bya ste /
translated: to use a cloth to wipe the face, to use a large rain cloak during the rainy season, and to accept what others offer.

original: chos gos gsum pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has hope of receiving more robes, one should accept them, but one should not let the opportunity pass.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni brkos pa'i zas dang / tshul shing gi zas dang / zla ba phyed pa'i zas dang / gso sbyong ba dang / dge 'dun gyi zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi zas skabs phye bas yongs su longs spyod par bya ste /🔽bsod snyoms pa nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni brkos pa'i zas dang / tshul shing gi zas dang / zla ba phyed pa'i zas dang / gso sbyong ba dang / dge 'dun gyi zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi zas skabs phye bas yongs su longs spyod par bya ste /🔽bsod snyoms pa nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The opportunity to beg for alms is to accept food that has been dug up, food that has been offered on a walking stick, food that is offered every half month, food that is offered on the observance day, food that is offered to the saṅgha, and food that is offered in the temple.🔽If one has hope of receiving more food, one should accept it, but one should not let the opportunity pass.

original: 'on kyang nyes dmigs su lta bas ni yong su longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes dmigs su lta bas ni yong su longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: But if he sees a disadvantage in that, he should not go.

original: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi @171a * //
analyzed: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid kyi @171a * //
translated: When he has an opportunity to go out of order,

original: skabs phye ba ni khyim gyi sgo nas glang po che dang / rta 'am /🔽khyu mchog gam /
analyzed: skabs phye ba ni khyim gyi sgo nas glang po che dang / rta 'am / khyu mchog gam /
translated: he should go out of order if he sees a house with elephants, horses,🔽bulls,

original: khyi 'am / 'thab pa 'am /
analyzed: khyi 'am / 'thab pa 'am /
translated: dogs,🔽or fighting, or if he sees something else that would cause shame.

original: ngo tsha bar 'gyur ba de lta bu gzhan mthong nas thod rgal du rgyu ba dang / zas bzar mi rung ba'i khyim mam /
analyzed: ngo tsha bar 'gyur ba de lta bu gzhan mthong nas thod rgal du rgyu ba dang / zas bzar mi rung ba'i khyim mam /
translated: He should go out of order if he sees a house where the food is not suitable,

original: lhung bzed khas phub pa'am /🔽slob bar grags pa'i khyim brgal nas rgyu ba dang / slob dpon nam /
analyzed: lhung bzed khas phub pa'am / slob bar grags pa'i khyim brgal nas rgyu ba dang / slob dpon nam /
translated: or where the alms-food is being taken away,🔽or where he is invited to a meal, or where he is invited to sit on the same seat, or where he is invited to eat from the same vessel, or where he is invited to eat from the same plate, or where he is invited to eat from the same container, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for drinking, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for eating, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for leftovers, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for rice, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for curry, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for cakes, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for fruit, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for roots, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for stalks, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for flowers, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for grain, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for beans, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for sesame seeds, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for rice and beans, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for rice and sesame seeds, or where he is invited to eat from the same container for rice, beans, and sesame seeds.🔽He should go out of order if he is going with his preceptor, teacher, or a visitor,

original: mkhan po'am / glo bur ba'am /
analyzed: mkhan po'am / glo bur ba'am /
translated: or if he is going with a fellow student, or if he is going with a companion, or if he is going with a group.

original: lhan cig rgyu na skabs phye bas thod rgal du yang rgyu bar bya ste /
analyzed: lhan cig rgyu na skabs phye bas thod rgal du yang rgyu bar bya ste /
translated: He should go out of order if he has an opportunity to do so,

original: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar chags su rgyu ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so that he does not violate the rule about going in order.🔽When he has an opportunity to sit on the same seat,🔽he should sit on the same seat if he sees a house with elephants, horses,🔽bulls,

original: stan gcig pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni zas za ba na glang po che'am /🔽rta 'am / khyu mchog gam /🔽sbrul lam / thog 'bab pa'am /
analyzed: stan gcig pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni zas za ba na glang po che'am /🔽rta 'am / khyu mchog gam /🔽sbrul lam / thog 'bab pa'am /
translated: snakes,

original: mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /
analyzed: mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /
translated: or a preceptor, or a teacher,

original: glo bur ba 'ongs pa mthong nas gal te langs par 'gyur na skabs phye bas yang bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: glo bur ba 'ongs pa mthong nas gal te langs par 'gyur na skabs phye bas yang bza' bar bya ste /
translated: or seeing a guest, if he stands up, then because he has made an exception, he may eat again.

original: stan gcig nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stan gcig nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he should not destroy the single seat.

original: zas chog pa pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid la ni skabs phye ba med do //
analyzed: zas chog pa pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid la ni skabs phye ba med do //
translated: There is no exception for the practice of eating only what is received and not accepting food after having arisen from one’s seat.

original: dgon pa pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par las kyi ched dam /
analyzed: dgon pa pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par las kyi ched dam /
translated: There is an exception for the practice of living in the wilderness: if he goes to a village for the sake of the ceremony of full ordination,

original: ltung ba las bslang ba'i ched dam /
analyzed: ltung ba las bslang ba'i ched dam /
translated: for the sake of the ceremony of lifting restrictions,

original: chos mnyan pa'i ched dam /🔽gso sbyong ngam /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i ched dam / gso sbyong ngam /
translated: for the sake of listening to the Dharma,

original: dgag dbye 'am /🔽na ba 'am /
analyzed: dgag dbye 'am / na ba 'am /
translated: for the ceremony of confession,🔽for the ceremony of the rainy season retreat,

original: nad pa'i bya ba'am /
analyzed: nad pa'i bya ba'am /
translated: for the sake of illness,🔽for the sake of nursing the sick,

original: mngon par mi shes pa'i mdo kun chub bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa'i mdo kun chub bar bya ba'am /
translated: for the sake of memorizing a sūtra that he does not know,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu'i rkyen yod na skabs phye bas grong mthar gnas par bya ste dgon pa pa nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu'i rkyen yod na skabs phye bas grong mthar gnas par bya ste dgon pa pa nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or for the sake of other such conditions, then because he has made an exception, he may live at the edge of a village, but he should not destroy the practice of living in the wilderness.🔽There is an exception for the practice of living at the foot of a tree: if he goes to a village for the sake of such conditions,

original: shing drung ba nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni rkyen de lta bu'am /
analyzed: shing drung ba nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni rkyen de lta bu'am /
translated: The opportunity to be a forest renunciant is such a condition.🔽🔽

original: khyim du zhugs pa las char gyis non na /
analyzed: khyim du zhugs pa las char gyis non na /
translated: If he enters his house and the rain stops,

original: de nyid du skya rengs shar yang shing drung pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid du skya rengs shar yang shing drung pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not violate the rule by staying under the tree until dawn.🔽The same applies to the tree-root-dweller and the open-air-dweller,

original: dgon pa pa'i skabs phye ba ji snyed pa ni shing drung ba nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa pa'i skabs phye ba ji snyed pa ni shing drung ba nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: but the charnel-ground-dweller should leave the charnel ground at sunset.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni rkyen de lta bu yod la gzhan gyi gnas mal rnyed na rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid kyi skabs phye ba ni rkyen de lta bu yod la gzhan gyi gnas mal rnyed na rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: The rule about staying in one place is suspended if one finds a suitable dwelling of another monk.

original: cog bu pa la ni skabs phye ba med do //
analyzed: cog bu pa la ni skabs phye ba med do //
translated: The rule about sitting cross-legged is not suspended.

original: kha cig na re sna'i dpyad byed na skabs phye bar bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re sna'i dpyad byed na skabs phye bar bya ste /
translated: Some say that the rule is suspended if one undergoes medical treatment,

original: cog pu ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cog pu ba nyid nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because sitting cross-legged is impossible.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gsum po de dag ni mdor bsdus na brgyad kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gsum po de dag ni mdor bsdus na brgyad kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: These thirteen ascetic practices are summarized as eight,

original: chos mngon pa las ji skad du sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni brgyad do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ji skad du sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni brgyad do zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: as stated in the Abhidharma.

original: gal te de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: zas chog pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid ni @171b zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas chog pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid ni @171b zas phyis mi len pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascetic practices of being satisfied with whatever comes and of having only one session of eating are included in the ascetic practice of not taking food at improper times.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bzung ba'i mtha' pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang skal gcig len pa yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bzung ba'i mtha' pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang skal gcig len pa yin te /
translated: Why is this?

original: de lta bas na zas chog pa pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na zas chog pa pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the ascetic practice of being satisfied with whatever comes is included in the ascetic practice of not taking food at improper times.

original: yang lan gnyis su mi za ste /
analyzed: yang lan gnyis su mi za ste /
translated: One does not eat a second time,

original: de lta bas na stan gcig pa nyid du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na stan gcig pa nyid du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so the ascetic practice of having only one session of eating is included in the ascetic practice of not taking food at improper times.

original: shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid ni dgon pa pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid ni dgon pa pa nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascetic practices of living at the foot of a tree, in the open, and in a charnel ground are included in the ascetic practice of living in the forest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dgon pa pa ni dgon par spyil bu dang / yang thog la sogs pa byed na las dga' ba nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chags pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam nas shing drung ngam /
analyzed: dgon pa pa ni dgon par spyil bu dang / yang thog la sogs pa byed na las dga' ba nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chags pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam nas shing drung ngam /
translated: Because the ascetic practice of living in the forest is the practice of living in a forest hut, a lean-to, or the like, and the ascetic practice of living at the foot of a tree is the practice of living at the foot of a tree.

original: bla gab med pa 'am /
analyzed: bla gab med pa 'am /
translated: in the open air,🔽

original: dur khrod du gnas so //
analyzed: dur khrod du gnas so //
translated: He lives in the open air or in the charnel ground.

original: de lta bas na brgyad kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bas na brgyad kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, there are eight.

original: brgyad po de dag kyang dgon pa pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag kyang dgon pa pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And these eight are completed by three: the forest dweller, the refuse-rag wearer, and the alms-food eater.

original: de ltar na sbyangs pa'i sgo gsum rdzogs par byed na /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyangs pa'i sgo gsum rdzogs par byed na /
translated: Thus, if one completes the three doors of austerity,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one completes all the austerities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mdzes dga' bol brten nas dga' bo nam zhig dgon pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / ngan ngon gyis 'tsho zhing 'dod pa rnams la ni lta ba med ba mthong zhig gu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mdzes dga' bol brten nas dga' bo nam zhig dgon pa dang / phyag dar khrod pa dang / ngan ngon gyis 'tsho zhing 'dod pa rnams la ni lta ba med ba mthong zhig gu zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, the Lord, in the context of the venerable Nandaka, said: “When will I see Nandaka living in the forest, wearing refuse rags, living on alms-food, and not looking at sense objects?”

original: de la sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What are the branches of austerity?

original: sbyangs pa'i chos ni du zhig yod /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i chos ni du zhig yod /
translated: How many are the dharmas of austerity?

original: ci spyod pa'i gang zag dag ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'/
analyzed: ci spyod pa'i gang zag dag ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'/
translated: What kind of person delights in practicing the austerities?

original: sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni du zhig / mthar thug pa ni du zhig / ci sbyangs pa'i de nyid sbyangs pa smra ba yang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni du zhig / mthar thug pa ni du zhig / ci sbyangs pa'i de nyid sbyangs pa smra ba yang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the reality of purification also the one who speaks of purification?

original: de la sbyangs pa'i yan lag ces bya ba ni gzhi bcu gsum po de dag gi spong ba gang yin ba de ni sbyangs pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i yan lag ces bya ba ni gzhi bcu gsum po de dag gi spong ba gang yin ba de ni sbyangs pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: The branches of purification are the abandonments of the thirteen bases.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan cir brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan cir brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the virtue of purification?

original: dge ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is virtue.

original: sbyangs pa'i chos du zhe na /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i chos du zhe na /
translated: How many are the phenomena of purification?

original: sbyangs pa'i chos ni gnyis te ma chags pa dang / gti mug med pa ste /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i chos ni gnyis te ma chags pa dang / gti mug med pa ste /
translated: There are two phenomena of purification: nonattachment and nondelusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du phyag dar khrod pa gang yin pa de ne 'dod pa chung ba nyid la brten /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du phyag dar khrod pa gang yin pa de ne 'dod pa chung ba nyid la brten /
translated: The Bhagavat said, “The one who is a refuse rag wearer relies on few desires,

original: chog shes pa nyid la brten /
analyzed: chog shes pa nyid la brten /
translated: relies on contentment,

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid la brten /
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid la brten /
translated: relies on reducing possessions,

original: rab tu dben ba nyid la brten /
analyzed: rab tu dben ba nyid la brten /
translated: relies on solitude,

original: 'dis chog ba nyid la brten nas phyag dar khrod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽rnam pa gcig tu na ma chags phas rjes su gnang ba 'tsham par bsten @172a * //
analyzed: 'dis chog ba nyid la brten nas phyag dar khrod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // rnam pa gcig tu na ma chags phas rjes su gnang ba 'tsham par bsten @172a * //
translated: And by relying on contentment, one becomes a refuse-rag wearer.

original: pas 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su brtson pa slu ba sel la sbyangs pa'i yon tan gti mug med pa ni yo byad bsnyungs par 'tsham par bsten pas bdag nyid dub pa'i rjes su brtson pa'i slu ba sel te /
analyzed: pas 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su brtson pa slu ba sel la sbyangs pa'i yon tan gti mug med pa ni yo byad bsnyungs par 'tsham par bsten pas bdag nyid dub pa'i rjes su brtson pa'i slu ba sel te /
translated: In another way, the practice of the ascetic practices of fewness of wishes and contentment is the antidote to the deception of striving for the enjoyments of desire. The practice of the ascetic practices of resourcefulness and plainness is the antidote to the deception of striving for one’s own comfort.

original: de lta bas na sbyangs pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyangs pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, there are two ascetic practices:

original: ma chags pa dang / gti mug med pa yin no //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / gti mug med pa yin no //
translated: nonattachment and nondelusion.

original: de la 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / chog shes pa nyid dang / rab tu dben pa nyid ni ma chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang / chog shes pa nyid dang / rab tu dben pa nyid ni ma chags pa yin no //
translated: Among them, fewness of wishes and contentment are nonattachment.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid dang / 'dis chog pa nyid ni gti mug med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid dang / 'dis chog pa nyid ni gti mug med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Resourcefulness and plainness are nondelusion.

original: de la ma chags pas ni spang ba'i gzhi bcu gsum la chags pa sel la /
analyzed: de la ma chags pas ni spang ba'i gzhi bcu gsum la chags pa sel la /
translated: Among them, nonattachment removes attachment to the thirteen bases of relinquishment.

original: gti mug med pas ni gzhi de dag nyid la nyes dmigs mi shes pa sel to //
analyzed: gti mug med pas ni gzhi de dag nyid la nyes dmigs mi shes pa sel to //
translated: The absence of confusion eliminates the ignorance of the faults of those bases.

original: yang ci spyod pa'i gang zag rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga' zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci spyod pa'i gang zag rnams sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga' zhe na /
translated: Moreover, do the persons who practice the perfections delight in relying on the virtues of purification?

original: 'dod chags spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'i /
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'i /
translated: Those who practice desire and those who practice confusion delight in relying on the virtues of purification.

original: zhe sdang spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who practice hatred do not.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags spyod pa dang ; gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags spyod pa dang ; gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten gyi /
translated: Why do those who practice desire and those who practice confusion delight in relying on the virtues of purification?

original: zhe sdang spyod pa'i ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa'i ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do those who practice hatred not?

original: sbyangs pa'i yin tan bsten pa ni /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yin tan bsten pa ni /
translated: Relying on the virtues of purification

original: bsgrub dga' ba yin pas 'dod chags spyod pa bsgrub dga' ba la brten nas 'dod chags rnam par gnon par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsgrub dga' ba yin pas 'dod chags spyod pa bsgrub dga' ba la brten nas 'dod chags rnam par gnon par 'gyur la /
translated: is delightful to accomplish. Therefore, those who practice desire delight in relying on what is delightful to accomplish and they overcome desire.

original: gti mug spyod pa yang sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten pa yang dag par blangs pa yo byad bsnyungs pa la brten nas rtag tu bag yod par 'gyur zhing bag yod na gti mug rnam par gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug spyod pa yang sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten pa yang dag par blangs pa yo byad bsnyungs pa la brten nas rtag tu bag yod par 'gyur zhing bag yod na gti mug rnam par gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who practices delusion, by taking up the virtues of austerity, by relying on few possessions, becomes always heedful. And when heedful, delusion is overcome.

original: de lta bas na 'dod chags spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod chags spyod pa dang / gti mug spyod pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga'i /
translated: Therefore, the one who practices passion and the one who practices delusion delight in taking up the virtues of austerity.

original: zhe sdang spyod pa ni bsgrub dga' na mkhris pa'i nad la drod bag byin pa bzhin du phyir zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa ni bsgrub dga' na mkhris pa'i nad la drod bag byin pa bzhin du phyir zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: But the one who practices aversion, if he delights in practice, like giving heat to one who has a fever, aversion arises again.

original: de lta bas na zhe sdang spyod pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhe sdang spyod pa ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsten par dga' ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who practices aversion delights in taking up the virtues of austerity.

original: gzhan dag na re zhe sdang spyod pa ni dgon pa ba nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhe sdang spyod pa ni dgon pa ba nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dag go //
translated: Others say: The one who practices aversion delights in the virtues of austerity, in the wilderness and at the foot of a tree.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung na gnas na de dag tu mi 'dod pas gtse ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung na gnas na de dag tu mi 'dod pas gtse ba'i nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: and in a monastery or under a tree, there is no fault of being disturbed by others who do not desire that.

original: sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni dus kyi mthar thug pa'i du zhig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yan lag ni dus kyi mthar thug pa'i du zhig ces bya ba ni /
translated: How many of the ascetic practices are there in the end?

original: sbyangs pa'i yan lag gsum po shing drung pa nyid dang / bla ga ba med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid zla ba brgyad kyi mthar thug par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yan lag gsum po shing drung pa nyid dang / bla ga ba med pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid zla ba brgyad kyi mthar thug par bya ste /
translated: The three ascetic practices of dwelling at the foot of a tree, without a roof overhead, and in a charnel ground are to be practiced until the end of the eighth month.

original: dbyar ni g-yogs par gnas @172b par bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo //
analyzed: dbyar ni g-yogs par gnas @172b par bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo //
translated: The Bhagavān permitted dwelling with a covering during the rainy season.

original: ci sbyangs pa de nyid sbyangs par smra ba yang de yin nam zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa yin la /
analyzed: ci sbyangs pa de nyid sbyangs par smra ba yang de yin nam zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa yin la /
translated: Are those who are ascetics also ascetics who speak of asceticism?

original: sbyangs pa smra ba yang de yin nam zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa yin la sbyangs pa smra ba yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: sbyangs pa smra ba yang de yin nam zhes bya ba ni sbyangs pa yin la sbyangs pa smra ba yin pa yang yod /
translated: There are ascetics who are also ascetics who speak of asceticism.🔽There are those who are not ascetics but speak of asceticism.

original: sbyangs pa ma yin la sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod /🔽sbyangs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sbyangs pa ma yin la sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod /🔽sbyangs pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are those who are neither ascetics nor speak of asceticism.

original: sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽de la sbyangs pa yang yin /
analyzed: sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod do // de la sbyangs pa yang yin /
translated: There are those who are not ascetics but who claim to be ascetics.

original: sbyangs pa smra ba yang yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni /🔽dgra bcom pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽sbyangs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sbyangs pa smra ba yang yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni / dgra bcom pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa'o // sbyangs pa ma yin la /
translated: There are those who are ascetics and who claim to be ascetics.🔽There are those who are not ascetics but who claim to be ascetics.

original: sbyangs pa smra ba yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa smra ba yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: There are those who are ascetics but who do not claim to be ascetics.

original: sbyangs pa yin la sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni /🔽slob pa'am / so so'i skye bo sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽sbyangs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sbyangs pa yin la sbyangs pa smra ba ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni / slob pa'am / so so'i skye bo sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa'o // sbyangs pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are those who are not ascetics and who do not claim to be ascetics.🔽There are those who are ascetics and who claim to be ascetics.🔽There are those who are not ascetics but who claim to be ascetics.🔽There are those who are ascetics but who do not claim to be ascetics.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan smra ba yang ma yin pa yod ces bya ba ni /🔽slob pa'am / so so'i skye bo sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan smra ba yang ma yin pa yod ces bya ba ni /🔽slob pa'am / so so'i skye bo sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: There are those who are not ascetics and who do not claim to be ascetics.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ci yin /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ci yin /
translated: What is the definition of the virtues of austerity?

original: ma nog ni ci yin /
analyzed: ma nog ni ci yin /
translated: What is the absence of confusion?

original: nye bar gnas pa ni ci zhe na sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni ci zhe na sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid do //
translated: What is the state of being present? The definition of the virtues of austerity is the quality of having few desires.

original: mnog ni chog shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: mnog ni chog shes pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of confusion is the quality of being satisfied with what one has.

original: nye bar gnas pa ni yo byad bsnyungs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni yo byad bsnyungs pa'o //
translated: The state of being present is the quality of having few needs.

original: rnam pa gcig tu mtshan nyid ni ma 'bags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu mtshan nyid ni ma 'bags pa'o //
translated: In another way, the definition is the absence of defilement.

original: mnog ni nyes dmigs med pa'o //
analyzed: mnog ni nyes dmigs med pa'o //
translated: The absence of confusion is the absence of danger.

original: nye bar gnas ba ni brtson pa mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas ba ni brtson pa mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: The state of being present is the quality of not abandoning effort.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma ni gang yin /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma ni gang yin /
translated: What is the beginning of the virtues of austerity?

original: bar ma ni gang yin /
analyzed: bar ma ni gang yin /
translated: What is the middle?

original: tha ma ni gang yin zhe na sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma ni yang dag par len pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni gang yin zhe na sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma ni yang dag par len pa'o //
translated: What is the end? The beginning of the virtues of austerity is the correct undertaking.

original: bar ma ni sten pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma ni sten pa'o //
translated: The middle is the practice.

original: tha ma ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The end is the joy.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam las sbyangs pa'i yon tan bstan pa zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam las sbyangs pa'i yon tan bstan pa zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is the third chapter, called “The Teaching on the Virtues of Austerity,” from “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bidy'a ka ra pra bha dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal brtsegs kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Vidyakaraprabha and the great editor and translator Bandé Pal-tsek translated, edited, and finalized it.
